newsitem.title: USA: Bear Stearns named in lawsuit - attorneys.
newsitem.headline: Bear Stearns named in lawsuit - attorneys.

text.p: Bear Stearns & Co Inc was named in a lawsuit claiming that it manipulated stock prices in its dealings as clearing agent for the now-defunct A.R. Baron & Co, the plaintiffs' attorneys said in a statement.
Bear Stearns was not immediately available for comment.

The lawyers allege that Bear Stearns Securities, among other things, assumed the actual trading function for Baron with respect to purchases and sales of shares of certain companies between July 20, 1995 and June 28, 1996.
Plaintiffs seek to recover losses suffered by themselves and other investors, the law firms said.
The law firms representing the plaintiffs are Goodkind Labaton Rudoff & Sucharow LLP, Finkelstein Thompson & Loughran and McElroy, Deutsch & Mulvaney.
